channel.title: Histogram on Ivona's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Histogram on Ivona's blog

item.title: Histogram
item.description: Here you can see how to make an Histagram! In this example we want to see the weights of MLB players, through the Master table. But firstly, we have to install those pakages: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) For this example, we need to use the Master table to gather its data. query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) Also, we have to use handy tool ggplot2: ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=result,aes(x=weight),color="purple",fill="white",bins=50)+ ggtitle("Body-weight Distribution for Baseball Players")+ xlab("Weight of player")+ ylab("Number of players") ## Warning: Removed 854 rows containing non-finite values (stat_bin).
